method.name: emulation_bgp_flow_spec_config
method.description: This procedure allows user to configure BGP Flow Spec capabilites of BGP Peer. BGP Flow Spec enables user rapidly deploy and propagate filtering and policing functionality among a large number of BGP peer.

description.text: This option defines the action to be taken on the BGP server.

choice.choiceText: modify the BGP FlowSpec configuration, requires the use of -handle.
Helps to modify the BGP FlowSpec configuration, requires the use of -handle.

description.text: This option defines the type of Flowspec.

bgp_flowSpecV4_handle: -handle is returned by procedure emulation_bgp_flow_spec_config when a IPv4 Flow Spec is created or modified bgp_flowSpecV6_handle: -handle is returned by procedure emulation_bgp_flow_spec_config when a IPv6 Flow Spec is created or modified
Number of IPV4 Flow Spec Ranges
Number of IPV6 Flow Spec Ranges

Select the Active check box to activate the Flow Spec. This means that the Flow Spec can be started or stopped and is usable in the state machine. If this check box is not selected, the element is not able to respond to any action including Start and Stop.
BGP Flow Spec Name
Enables Destination Prefix and Prefix Length for Flow Spec
Enables Destination Prefix and Prefix Length for Flow Spec
Destination Prefix for IPv4 Flow Spec
Destination Prefix for IPv6 Flow Spec
Destination Prefix Length for IPv4 Flow Spec
Destination Prefix Length for IPv6 Flow Spec
Destination Prefix Offset for IPv6 Flow Spec
Enables Source Prefix and Prefix Length for IPv4 Flow Spec
Enables Source Prefix and Prefix Length for IPv6 Flow Spec
Source Prefix for IPv4 Flow Spec
Source Prefix for IPv6 Flow Spec
Source Prefix Length for IPv4 Flow Spec
Source Prefix Length for IPv6 Flow Spec
Source Prefix Offset for IPv6 Flow Spec
IPv4 Flow Spec Proto Match. Minimum Value: 0 Maximum Value: 65535
IPv6 Flow Spec Next Header
Flow Spec Port match. Minimum Value: 0 Maximum Value: 65535
Flow Spec Destination Port Match. Minimum Value: 0 Maximum Value: 65535
Flow Spec Source Port Match. Minimum Value: 0 Maximum Value: 65535
Flow Spec ICMP Type Match. Minimum Value: 0 Maximum Value: 255
Flow Spec ICMP Code Match. Minimum Value: 0 Maximum Value: 255
Flow Spec TCP Flags Match. Minimum Value: 0 Maximum Value: 0xFFF
Flow Spec IP Packet Match. Minimum Value: 0 Maximum Value: 65535
Flow Spec DSCP Match. Minimum Value: 0 Maximum Value: 63
IPv4 Flow Spec Fragment Match. Minimum Value: 0 Maximum Value: 0xFF
IPv6 Flow Spec Fragment Match. Minimum Value: 0 Maximum Value: 0xFF
IPv6 Flow Spec Flow Label
Enable Traffic Rate for Flow Spec
Traffic Rate for Flow Spec
Enable Traffic Action for Flow Spec
Enable Terminal Action for Flow Spec. Set Terminal(T) flag for Traffic action
Traffic Action Sample for Flow Spec. Set Sample(S) flag for Traffic action
Enable Redirect for Flow Spec
Relates to the high-order Extended Community Type field for Flow Spec Actions

choice.choiceText: Extended Community Type - Redirect AS-2 byte
Extended Community Type - Redirect AS-4 byte
Extended Community Type - Redirect to IP Next Hop

description.text: 2-byte Autonomous System (AS) number for Flow Spec
4-byte Autonomous System (AS) number for Flow Spec
IP Address for IPv4 Flow Spec
IP Address for IPv6 Flow Spec
2 Octet assigned Number for Flow Spec
4 Octet assigned Number for Flow Spec
C Bit for Flow Spec. It is the highest order bit in the VC Type field. If the bit is set, it indicates the presence of a control word on this VC.
Next Hop for Flow Spec
Enable Traffic Marking for Flow Spec
DSCP for IPv4 Flow Spec
Enable Redirect IPv6 for IPv6 Flow Spec
Redirected IPv6 Address for IPv6 Flow Spec
Enable Next Hop for Flow Spec
Set IP Address of Next Hop for Flow Spec

choice.choiceText: Set Next Hop to Same as local IP

description.text: Set Next Hop IP Type for Flow Spec

choice.choiceText: Sets Next Hop Ip type to IPv4
Sets Next Hop Ip type to IPv6

description.text: IPv4 Next Hop IP Address for Flow Spec
IPv6 Next Hop IP Address for Flow Spec
Enable Origin for Flow Spec
Origin for Flow Spec
Enable Local Preference for Flow Spec
Local Preference for Flow Spec
Enable Multi Exit Discriminator for Flow Spec
Multi Exit Discriminator for Flow Spec
Enable Atomic Aggregate for Flow Spec
Enable Aggregator ID for Flow Spec
Aggregator ID for Flow Spec
Sets the AS asssociated with the Aggregator router id for Flow Spec
Enable Originator ID for Flow Spec
Originator ID for the router that originated the rule for Flow Spec
Enable Community for BGP Flow Spec
Number of Communities for Flow Spec
BGP Flow Spec Community Types

restriction.value: no_export no_advertised noexport_subconfed manual llgr_stale no_llgr

description.text: BGP Flow Spec AS Number
BGP FlowSpec Last Two Octets
Enables or disables Large communities.
Internal mapping to implicit list length param
Large Community in cannonical format as defined in RFC8092 which is: GlobalAdmin:LocalDataPart1:LocalDataPart2 where each value must have range 1-4294967295. e.g. 65535:100:10 or 4294967295:1:65535
Enable Ext Community for Flow Spec
Number of Extended Communities for Flow Spec
BGP Flow Spec Extended Communities Type

choice.choiceText: Extended Community type - Administrator AS2 octet
Extended Community type - Administrator AS4 octet
Extended Community type - Administrator AS2 Octet Link Bandwidth

restriction.value: admin_as_two_octet admin_ip admin_as_four_octet opaque evpn admin_as_two_octet_link_bw

description.text: BGP Flow Spec Extended Communities SubType

choice.choiceText: Extended Community sub type - Route target
Extended Community sub type - Extended bandwidth

restriction.value: route_target origin extended_bandwidth color encapsulation mac_address

description.text: BGP Flow Spec Extended Communities AS2 Number
BGP Flow Spec Extended Communities Target Assigned Number 4
BGP Flow Spec Extended Communites IP
BGP Flow Spec Extended Community AS 4 Number
BGP Flow Spec Extended Target Assigned Number 2
BGP Flow Spec Extended Communities Opaque Data (Hex)

BGP Flow Spec Extended Communities Color Reserved Bits
BGP Flow Spec Extended Communities Color Value
BGP Flow Spec Extended Communities Link Bandwidth
Enable override Reer as set mode for Flow Spec
Set mode for AS value for Flow Spec

choice.choiceText: Prepend Local AS to first segment

restriction.value: include_as_seq include_as_seq_conf include_as_set include_as_set_conf no_include prepend_as

description.text: Enable AS Path Segments for Flow Spec
Number of AS Path Segments for Flow Spec
Enable AS Path Segment for BGP Flow Spec
AS Path Segment Type for BGP Flow Spec

choice.choiceText: AS Path Segment Type - Include Local AS as AS-SEQ
AS Path Segment Type - Include Local AS as AS-SEQ-Confederation
AS Path Segment Type - Include Local AS as AS-SET
AS Path Segment Type - Include Local AS as AS-SET-Confederation

description.text: Number of AS Path Segments for BGP Flow Spec
Enable AS number for BGP Flow Spec
AS Path Segments AS Number for BGP Flow Spec
Enable cluster for Flow Spec
Number of Clusters for Flow Spec
BGP LS Cluster ID for BGP Flow Specs

returnValue.value: A list containing the bgp flowSpecV6 protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
When status is $::FAILURE, contains more information
Item Handle of any bgpFlowSpecRangesListV4 or bgpFlowSpecRangesListV6 configured

notes.note: Coded versus functional specification. When a -handle is provided with a BGP/BGP+ protocol stack handle or a protocol session handle, the api will create IPv4/IPv6 Flow Spec When a -handle is provided with a BGP Flow Spec Handle, the api will modify the created IPv4/IPv6 Flow Spec

examples.example: See files starting with BGP_ in the Samples subdirectory. Also see some of the L2VPN, L3VPN, MPLS, and MVPN sample files for further examples of the BGP usage. See the BGP example in Appendix A, "Example APIs," for one specific example usage.
